page.title: 04LOCAL BUILDINGS
page.content: Stockton on Forest is a village of about 900 people it is only four miles from the city of York but it is a complete village, rather than a suburb of York like on the other three sides of the city. The main street is made of houses which are red brick and pantiles.Most are over 200 years old. The most important building is a four storey red bricked mansion called Stockton Hall. It was built in Georgian times. Up until about 1965 it was owned by the Agar family but now it is a home for boys who have no parents or those who have got into trouble.The village has one pub called "The Fox" where every year the hunt meets outside on one particular day.
